programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress

programme.title: Raising Arizona
programme.desc: A habitual thief and his cop wife are distraught to discover they cannot have children, so set out to kidnap one of five babies born to a local tycoon. Coen brothers comedy, starring Nicolas Cage, Holly Hunter, John Goodman and Frances McDormand. Joel Coen Nicolas Cage Holly Hunter John Goodman Frances McDormand Trey Wilson William Forsythe Randall `Tex' Cobb Sam McMurray Lynne Dumin Kitei Sidney Dawson

programme.title: Turner & Hooch

programme.title: Don't Think Twice

programme.desc: Blundering cop Frank Drebin discovers a secret conspiracy to kidnap a renowned solar energy expert and replace him with an imposter. Slapstick comedy sequel, starring Leslie Nielsen, Priscilla Presley, George Kennedy, Richard Griffiths and OJ Simpson. David Zucker Leslie Nielsen Priscilla Presley George Kennedy OJ Simpson Richard Griffiths Robert Goulet Jacqueline Brookes John Roarke

programme.title: Shallow Hal
programme.desc: Superficial Hal is only interested in dating physically perfect women, but his outlook is changed when a self-help guru hypnotises him into seeing inner beauty - and he ends up falling for a spirited overweight woman. However, when the hypnosis wears off he struggles to remember that looks are not everything. Farrelly Brothers comedy, starring Gwyneth Paltrow, Jack Black, Jason Alexander and Joe Viterelli. Bobby Farrelly, Peter Farrelly Gwyneth Paltrow Jack Black Jason Alexander Joe Viterelli Rene Kirby Bruce McGill Tony Robbins Susan Ward Kyle Gass Brooke Burns

Action comedy, starring Will Ferrell, Mark Wahlberg, Steve Coogan and Eva Mendes. programme.title: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A disorganised woman is asked to be maid of honour at her best friend's wedding. Taking charge of the prenuptial bridal celebrations, she resolves to give her pal and accompanying bridesmaids the time of their lives, but as her efforts slide into chaos she finds the wife of the groom's boss is keen to usurp her position. Comedy, with Kristen Wiig, Rose Byrne and Melissa McCarthy. Paul Feig Kristen Wiig Rose Byrne Melissa McCarthy Maya Rudolph Wendi McLendon-Covey Ellie Kemper Michael Hitchcock Chris O'Dowd

programme.title: Hitch
programme.desc: A professional relationship guru, who specialises in offering advice to lonely single men, helps an unlucky-in-love accountant to woo the girl of his dreams. Romantic comedy, with Will Smith, Eva Mendes, Kevin James, Amber Valletta, Julie Ann Emery, Adam Arkin and Michael Rapaport. Andy Tennant Will Smith Eva Mendes Kevin James Amber Valletta Julie Ann Emery Adam Arkin Robinne Lee Michael Rapaport

programme.title: Clue
programme.desc: Six strangers who are all being blackmailed are summoned to a remote mansion run by a bizarre butler, to meet the man who knows their secrets. When the blackmailer subsequently turns up dead, the guests must uncover which of them is the guilty party - or if someone else is in the house. Comedy, based on the board game Cluedo, starring Tim Curry, Madeline Kahn, Christopher Lloyd, Lesley Ann Warren and Michael McKean. Jonathan Lynn Tim Curry Christopher Lloyd Madeline Kahn Michael McKean Lesley Ann Warren Eileen Brennan Martin Mull Lee Ving Colleen Camp

programme.title: Stuck on You
programme.desc: Conjoined twins head for the bright lights of Hollywood, where one of them lands a role on a TV show starring alongside Cher - but his dreams of acting success are hampered by his brother's determination to search for the woman he has been romancing online. Comedy from the Farrelly brothers, starring Matt Damon and Greg Kinnear, and featuring cameo appearances by Meryl Streep and Jack Nicholson as themselves. Bobby Farrelly, Peter Farrelly Matt Damon Greg Kinnear Eva Mendes Cher Seymour Cassel Wen Yann Shih Pat Crawford Brown Ray Valliere Meryl Streep Jack Nicholson

programme.title: Police Academy
programme.desc: An American police college lowers its entrance requirements in the hope of attracting new recruits, and in response, assorted dubious candidates turn up for enrolment. A short-tempered instructor is determined to weed out the bad apples, but a riot provides the clueless cops with a chance to prove their worth. Comedy, starring Steve Guttenberg, Kim Cattrall, Bubba Smith and GW Bailey. Hugh Wilson Steve Guttenberg Kim Cattrall Bubba Smith GW Bailey Donovan Scott George Gaynes David Graf Andrew Rubin

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A by-the-book Los Angeles cop is paired with a laidback new partner to investigate the nefarious activities of a TV evangelist and a pornographic-magazine baron suspected of operating a criminal cult. Comedy spoof of the 1950s TV series, starring Dan Aykroyd, Tom Hanks, Christopher Plummer and the original show's star Harry Morgan. Tom Mankiewicz Dan Aykroyd Tom Hanks Christopher Plummer Harry Morgan Dabney Coleman Alexandra Paul Jack O'Halloran Elizabeth Ashley Kathleen Freeman Bruce Gray

programme.title: Adult Beginners
programme.desc: An entrepreneur on the brink of success instead loses everything when the product he launches is a failure, prompting his friends to turn their backs on him. He retreats to the safety of his sister's home, where he is allowed to stay on the condition he helps look after her three-year-old son. Despite his haphazard attitude to childcare, he forms a close relationship with his nephew. Comedy drama, starring Nick Kroll, Rose Byrne and Bobby Cannavale. Ross Katz Rose Byrne Nick Kroll Bobby Cannavale Joel McHale Paula Garces Caitlin FitzGerald Jane Krakowski Mike Birbiglia

programme.title: Naked Gun 331/3: the Final Insult
programme.desc: Inept police detective Frank Drebin plans to retire from the force, but is lured back by the opportunity to foil a terrorist plot. Comedy sequel, starring Leslie Nielsen, Priscilla Presley, OJ Simpson, George Kennedy and Fred Ward. Peter Segal Leslie Nielsen Priscilla Presley OJ Simpson George Kennedy Fred Ward Ellen Greene Anna Nicole Smith Kathleen Freeman Raye Birk Earl Boen

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: A failed rock star carves out a career as a popular wedding singer, but his hopes for a bright future are dashed when his fiancee jilts him at the altar and he tries to shut himself off from the outside world. At one of his functions, a waitress catches his eye - but unfortunately for him, she is already engaged to someone else. Romantic comedy set in the 1980s, starring Adam Sandler and Drew Barrymore. Frank Coraci Adam Sandler Drew Barrymore Christine Taylor Allen Covert Angela Featherstone Steve Buscemi Billy Idol

programme.title: Rough Night
programme.desc: Things go terribly wrong for a group of girlfriends who hire a male stripper for a hen party in Miami. Comedy, starring Scarlett Johansson, Kate McKinnon and Zoe Kravitz. Lucia Aniello Scarlett Johansson Jillian Bell Zoe Kravitz Ilana Glazer Kate McKinnon Paul W Downs

programme.title: Roxanne
programme.desc: A sensitive fireman believes he has no chance of ever winning the heart of a lovely astronomer owing to his large nose, and instead agrees to help a handsome colleague woo her, causing himself no end of heartache. Romantic comedy based on Cyrano de Bergerac, starring Steve Martin, Daryl Hannah, Rick Rossovich and Shelley Duvall. Fred Schepisi Steve Martin Daryl Hannah Rick Rossovich Shelley Duvall Michael J Pollard John Kapelos Fred Willard Max Alexander Damon Wayans Steve Mittleman

programme.title: Little Man
programme.desc: A tiny baby-faced jewel thief tries to steal a priceless diamond for a gangster, only for it to end up in the home of a childless and gullible suburban couple. In a bid to get it back, the crook masquerades as an abandoned child to get himself adopted as their baby son - but comes to regret the ruse when he has to suffer nappy changes and being breastfed. Comedy, with Marlon and Shawn Wayans, Kerry Washington and Tracy Morgan. Keenen Ivory Wayans Marlon Wayans Shawn Wayans Kerry Washington Tracy Morgan Chazz Palminteri Alex Borstein John Witherspoon Lochlyn Munro

programme.title: Look Who's Talking

programme.title: Killer Women with Piers Morgan
programme.desc: Second of a two-part documentary in which Piers Morgan meets some of America's most notorious female murderers. First, Piers meets Amanda Lewis, who is serving a life sentence for killing her daughter. In rural Florida, seven-year-old Adrianna Hutto drowned in the family's outdoor pool. It looked like an accident, but Adrianna's younger brother AJ told police that his mum had deliberately dunked Adrianna as a punishment for being naughty. Piers finds out what it was like for Amanda to sit across from her son as he testified against her, and ultimately asks her the burning question - did she do it? Next, Piers travels to Texas for an encounter with Rhonda Glover, a former beauty queen and rodeo star who gunned down her lover in cold blood. Rhonda and her boyfriend Jimmy Joste shared a glamorous lifestyle built on the riches of his oil business, but their relationship spiralled into drug-fuelled obsession and paranoia before ending in murder

programme.title: Car Crash Britain
programme.desc: A fascinating two-part programme which looks at footage captured by members of the public on our roads and highways including head-on crashes, spectacular shunts and miraculous near-misses. The extraordinary growth in personal cameras mounted on drivers' dashboards and bike helmets means that very little that happens on Britain's roads goes unseen. The first programme has footage of some shocking accidents and crashes, and includes some miraculous escapes. Many are filmed by the people involved, and we meet some of those at the centre of these daily dramas

programme.desc: Davina McCall returns for her second night of live broadcasting from Leeds General Infirmary - one of the UK's busiest Accident and Emergency departments. Davina looks at how the NHS copes with the rising pressures on our hospitals and what makes it our most loved institution

programme.title: Manchester Bomb: Our Story
programme.desc: This observational documentary follows three young women who were directly affected by the terror attack at the Manchester Arena in May 2017. Erin, 11, witnessed the aftermath of the bombing and is unable to speak about what she saw. She suffers flashbacks and is scared to leave the house. For Amelia, 18, it was the first concert she had been to without her mum. She was physically injured by the explosion and now her mum struggles to let her out of her sight, terrified of losing her. Meanwhile, 20-year-old Louise's whole life has been put on hold while she struggles to deal with the loss of her brother, who was killed in the attack

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Jim Carrey stars as the late Andy Kaufman, who was considered one of the most innovative, eccentric and enigmatic performers of his time. A master at manipulating audiences, Kaufman could generate belly laughs, stony silence, tears or brawls. Whether inviting the audience out for milk and cookies or challenging women to inter-gender wrestling matches, he specialized in creating performances so real that even his close friends were never sure where the truth lay.

programme.title: Waitress
programme.desc: Jenna (Keri Russell) works in a diner in a small Southern town and is a genius at creating luscious desserts, but her marriage to an overbearing lout (Jeremy Sisto) makes happiness impossible. When she discovers she is pregnant, she makes plans to skip town before her condition is obvious. However, she begins an affair with the new town doctor (Nathan Fillion), who is the only one who knows her secret.

programme.title: Going in Style
programme.desc: Lifelong buddies Willie (Morgan Freeman), Joe (Michael Caine) and Albert (Alan Arkin) decide to buck retirement and step off the straight-and-narrow when their pension funds become a corporate casualty. Desperate to pay the bills and come through for their loved ones, the three men risk it all by embarking on a daring adventure to knock off the very bank that absconded with their money.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle
programme.desc: The Angels (Lucy Liu), (Drew Barrymore), (Cameron Diaz) are ready to go undercover to retrieve two missing silver wedding bands containing valuable encrypted information -- the new identities of every person in the Federal Witness Protection Program. When witnesses start to turn up dead, only the Angels can stop the perpetrator by using their expertise as masters of disguise, espionage, and martial arts.

programme.title: Laurel Canyon
programme.desc: Sam (Christian Bale) and his fiancee, Alex (Kate Beckinsale), move to Los Angeles for the summer to stay at the luxurious house of his mother, Jane (Frances McDormand), while she's away. But Jane, a hip record producer, has not left yet because she's still working on a project with her British musician boyfriend, Ian (Alessandro Nivola). Sam and Alex feel the pull of Jane's fast-paced, decadent lifestyle, and their relationship starts to fray when they get involved with other people.

programme.title: Dutch
programme.desc: Working man Dutch (Ed O'Neill) is dating the divorced Natalie (JoBeth Williams), and he offers to drive her stuffy 13-year-old, Doyle (Ethan Randall), from his private school in Atlanta to his mother's home in Chicago for Thanksgiving. Doyle is not interested as he blames Natalie for the divorce and wants nothing to do with Mom's new boyfriend, especially given the man's lowly, working-class roots. This pairing makes for a journey filled with bickering, mishaps and, eventually, bonding.

programme.title: Dana Carvey: Squatting Monkeys Tell No Lies
programme.desc: The comic performs at the Wells Fargo Center for the Arts in Santa Rosa, Calif.

programme.title: RocketMan
programme.desc: A clumsy, impulsive scientist (Harland Williams) is chosen to go aboard NASA's first manned flight to Mars.

programme.title: Odd Jobs
programme.desc: The summer job situation looks bleak for five college pals until they decide to start their own moving business.

programme.title: Cabin Boy
programme.desc: A prep-school snob (Chris Elliott) en route to Hawaii meets unfriendly fishermen aboard the wrong boat.

programme.title: Bad Company
programme.desc: CIA operative Kevin Pope (Chris Rock) is suave, brilliant and right on the verge of completing a top secret mission to keep a rogue nuclear weapon off the black market when he is suddenly killed. With the clock ticking and no other options available, the CIA reluctantly enlists Kevin's long-lost identical twin brother Jake to take his place. Jake is the mirror opposite of Kevin, a working class Joe, it's a comically uphill challenge to train him as a secret agent and get him in the field.

programme.title: David Spade: Take the Hit
programme.desc: The comedian wonders if he can endure the rebuke that goes with celebrity.

programme.title: Adam Sandler's Eight Crazy Nights
programme.desc: Davey Stone (Adam Sandler), a 33-year old party animal, finds himself in trouble with the law after his wild ways go too far. In keeping with the holiday spirit, the judge gives Davey one last chance at redemption -- spend the holiday performing community service as the assistant referee for the youth basketball league or go to jail. Davey thinks he's gotten off easy until he meets Whitey Duvall, the eccentric, elf-like head referee.

programme.title: Diner
programme.desc: Billy (Timothy Daly) returns home to Baltimore to serve as the best man at his upcoming wedding of his childhood buddy Eddie (Steve Guttenberg). In the meantime, he and Eddie get together with their friends at the local diner, where they trade stories about their lives. All they really want to do is go back to being the carefree boys they once were, but they know it cannot be. Their funny and at times revealing exchanges help each other face the mounting responsibility of adulthood.

programme.title: The House
programme.desc: Scott and Kate Johansen must figure out a way to earn some money after their daughter's scholarship falls through. When all else fails, the desperate couple join forces with their neighbor Frank to start an underground casino in his home. As the cash rolls in and the good times fly, Scott and Kate soon learn that they may have bitten off more than they can chew.

programme.title: Yes Man
programme.desc: Carl Allen (Jim Carrey) is stuck in a rut with his negative ways. Then he goes to a self-help seminar and learns to unleash the power of yes. Living in the affirmative leads him to all sorts of amazing and transforming experiences; he gets a job promotion, and even finds a new romance. But Carl finds that too much of anything, even positive thinking, is not necessarily a good thing.

programme.title: Talking Dead: Fear Edition
programme.desc: Chris Hardwick hosts the companion show to the US zombie drama Fear the Walking Dead, featuring interviews with the actors, producers and celebrity fans, and behind-the-scenes reports.

programme.title: The Terror
programme.desc: A strange illness begins to show itself while another more familiar one jeopardises the expedition's most valuable resource - the judgement of the captain.

programme.title: Tracks (2013)
programme.desc: An Australian woman abandons her life in the city with the intention of making a solo trek across the Australian Outback. She takes a job on an Alice Springs camel farm to get used to working with the animals, taking four of them and her trusty dog on a perilous 1,700-mile trek through the desert to the Indian Ocean. Fact-based drama, starring Mia Wasikowska and Adam Driver.(n)

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: The arrival of a wounded visitor in John Dorie's life forces him to change his ways. Post-apocalyptic drama, starring Garret Dillahunt.(n)

Medical drama, starring Patrick Dempsey.(n)

programme.title: Frida (2002)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biopic of talented Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, examining her enduring relationship with husband and mentor, the womanising muralist Diego Rivera, her own scandalous affairs, and her celebrated position at the centre of the art world. Starring Salma Hayek, Valeria Golino, Mia Maestro, Roger Rees, Diego Luna and Alfred Molina.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Darlington, perfectionist Clair Sherwood-Parkin is cooking up a Moroccan-inspired feast. The night gets off to an interesting start when Eseyoma Sodje introduces herself to the group as the "Queen of Sheba'. Although the Moroccan tagine proves underwhelming, Clair's `secrets" game gets the conversation flowing and some shocking truths are revealed, but will she manage to hold her nerve to bag the 1,000 prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's day two in Darlington and today's host is veterinary surgeon James Emson. He's serving up a mountain of curry and truly spicing up the evening with some of the most eye-opening entertainment ever seen. Will any of his guests go that extra step and try to eat an eyeball? Has James overstepped the mark, or has he hosted the most eye-catching night of the week in his bid to win the 1,000?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bachelor Barry l'Anson is pulling out all the stops with a dinner party inspired by love, an unexpected choice of theme that shows the group a very different side to the guy they all think is a jack the lad. Dinner party purist Clair is not impressed, while posh vet James is equally concerned about Barry's "Splashes of Love" dessert. Will Barry have earned enough love from his guests to bag the 1,000 prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glamorous go-getter Charlotte Langley, who's laying on a "Night with the Stars'. She's asked her guests to dress up as their favourite red carpet celebrity, although not everyone quite gets it right. As there"s friction on one side of the table, an unlikely bromance is developing on the other between James and Barry. Can Charlotte hold it all together to take the award for Best Dinner Party and the 1,000?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the final night in Darlington and the week is being rounded off with a "right royal knees up'. The host is Eseyoma, the self-proclaimed Queen of Sheba, and she's hoping that her Nigerian recipes, with an extra helping of glamour on the side, will be enough to convince her guests that she should win the 1,000. After a week of listening to her unique brand of honesty, Eseyoma"s going to have to work hard.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

Twin sisters take on twin brothers as the teams compete to buy three items that will make the most profit at auction. Providing a helping hand to the reds and blues are Raj Bisram and Kate Bliss. Meanwhile, Paul boldly goes where no "Bargain Hunt" presenter has gone before.

programme.desc: At Medals Day, Nicki Chapman and James Wong find out who's won gold at the show, before taking a closer look at some of the medal-winning gardens. programme.title: Burma with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon journeys up the vast Irrawaddy river to the old royal capital of Mandalay, home to an exotic market for precious jade. In Burma's mountainous highlands, he experiences Burma's vibrant ethnic heritage at an extraordinary and explosive fire-balloon festival, then visits an elephant sanctuary and finds out how a growing tourism industry is helping them survive after working for decades in the logging industry.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: A look at four police forces to ask if Britain's police can cope, with a surge of violent crime in London and recorded crime rising across the country. Forces are stretched to crisis point by eight years of austerity and a national shortage of detectives, and an exclusive analysis of police data shows how fewer crimes are ending up with any suspect charged.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The team are in Hampshire, where Matt Baker hears about a project championing the use of local wood, as more people using locally sourced timber leads to better-managed woodlands, and that means more biodiversity.

programme.title: The Super League Show

programme.title: Going Back, Giving Back
programme.desc: Aled Jones is going back to Liverpool in the 1960s to meet a man who escaped a childhood of poverty and has since devoted his entire life to helping others and raising money for charity. Can he give something back with a gift that will change her life?

programme.title: Ray Mears Goes Walkabout
programme.desc: Ray Mears is in desert survival mode as he follows in the footsteps of an unsung hero of Australian exploration to find out how John McDouall Stuart became the first European to succeed in crossing this continent from south to north and back again. Ray shows how to wring water from these barren lands and how travelling light is the key to success on such an epic journey.

programme.title: Victorian Farm
programme.desc: The team embark on a trip by steam train, Ruth begins a tough task in the dairy, Alex tries his hand at bee-keeping, and the sheep get sheared using the latest time-saving technology. The lengthening summer days also allow Alex and Peter to try out the new Victorian sport of cricket.

programme.title: Street Auction
programme.desc: Neighbours celebrate a Somerset man who spends all his time helping others, despite being in his 90s. Presenters Paul Martin and Danny Sebastian host a pop-up auction and surprise the unsuspecting nominee.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charles Hanson drafts in some extra help from his two-year-old daughter, Matilda, but can Natasha Raskin Sharp's canny buys see her beat her Derbyshire rival on his own patch? Charles hitches a ride on a horse and cart and buys a Flying Scotsman.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: The Eggheads team are made up of some of Britain's top quizzers. They face a team of challengers trying to beat the incumbents in order to win a cash prize. If the Eggheads beat the challengers, the cash prize is rolled over to subsequent episodes.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey from Derby to Lindisfarne. Beginning in Boston in the flatlands of Lincolnshire, Michael explores the connection between the city and its American namesake.

programme.title: Back to the Land with Kate Humble
programme.desc: Kate meets ex-marketing manager Emma and her business partner and shepherdess Suzie, who've teamed up with the ambition to produce the best woollen yarn in the UK. With neither women having drawn a salary in 7 years Kate joins them at a tricky point as they need to expand whilst staying true to their artisan roots. Also, Kate gets hands on with ex chef Richard the largest exotic mushroom grower in his region, who grows his mushrooms in two shipping containers on the edge of the New Forest.

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: It's been a day of high emotion at Chelsea, with the all-important medal results finally revealed. Monty Don and Joe Swift are on hand to give their views on who won gold and who missed out, as well as questioning the RHS judges on how they make their crucial decisions. Carol Klein is celebrating medals day with the exhibitors in the Great Pavilion, while fashion designer Ozwald Boateng visits the show to talk about Chelsea trends.

programme.title: Manchester: The Night of the Bomb
programme.desc: A powerful retelling of the 2017 terrorist attack. On May 22nd 2017 a Manchester-born man detonated a homemade bomb at an Ariana Grande pop concert, killing twenty-two people and himself. It was Britain's deadliest terrorist attack since 7/7. This is the story of that night in forensic detail, through the eyes of teenage girls who survived the attack and key members of the emergency services. It features unseen mobile phone video and unheard audio recordings.

programme.desc: Jools welcomes Bjork, Enter The Breeders, lead by sisters Kim and Kelley Deal, Les Amazones D'Afrique, Deva Mahal, and Hailey Tuck. Jools is also joined by LUMP, a collaboration between Laura Marling and Mike Lindsay.

programme.desc: In-depth investigation and analysis of the stories behind the day's headlines with Emily Maitlis.

programme.title: Britain's Best Home Cook
programme.desc: The best nine home cooks battle it out over their finest fish dish and improvise with squash or rice before the weakest face a tricky dessert elimination round. At the end of the challenges, one cook must say farewell.

programme.desc: Sam Willis traces the history of the British castle, from its first appearance with the Normans in 1066 to the longest siege on English soil at Kenilworth Castle 200-years-later.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Motorway
programme.desc: A celebration of the birth of the motorway and the achievements of those behind the "road revolution', beginning with a look at the engineers and builders who designed and built the first motorway, through to those who toiled to complete the most complex road intersection in the country, Birmingham"s Spaghetti Junction.

programme.title: Clydebuilt: The Ships That Made the Commonwealth
programme.desc: David looks at the story of the Cutty Sark and travels to Australia to uncover the links this iconic ship forged with this Commonwealth country, and to reflect on her legacy.

programme.title: Kew's Forgotten Queen
programme.desc: Within Kew Gardens stands an extraordinary gallery, celebrating the work of one of the most prolific botanical artists of the Victorian age. Marianne North's exploits defied convention as she travelled alone at the height of the British Empire.

programme.title: Codebreakers: Bletchley Park's Lost Heroes
programme.desc: Revealing an intellectual World War II feat that gave birth to the digital age. In 1943, a 24-year-old maths student and a GPO engineer combined to hack into Hitler's personal super code machine - not Enigma but an even tougher system, which he called his "secrets writer". Their break turned the Battle of Kursk, powered the D-day landings and orchestrated the end of the conflict in Europe.

programme.title: Royal Wives at War
programme.desc: A revealing new look at the abdication crisis of 1936 through the eyes of the two women at its very heart. In a series of dramatized monologues set in 1967, Elizabeth the Queen Mother and Wallis Simpson look back at the dramatic events, which led to King Edward VIII giving up the throne for the woman he loved.

programme.title: This Is BBC Four
programme.desc: BBC FOUR is the BBC channel for people who want more. More depth, more range, more to stimulate the mind.

programme.title: SIGN OFF
programme.desc: Sign off.

programme.title: SIGN OFF
programme.desc: Sign off.

programme.title: Beyond 100 Days
programme.desc: Katty Kay in Washington and Christian Fraser in London report on events that are shaping the world.

programme.title: Iolo's Snowdonia
programme.desc: Iolo starts his journey during spring in Nant Ffrancon in the Ogwen Valley where he finds one of Britain's most-threatened birds, the twite. Mountain guide Hannah Hughes takes him high up above the glacial landscape of Cwm Idwal for a spectacular view of the high peaks, and on the slopes of Snowdon, shepherd Hefin Hughes keeps the sheep off arctic plants, and on the foothills of the Rhinog Mountains, cuckoos call.

programme.title: Tomorrow's Worlds: The Unearthly History of Science Fiction
programme.desc: What if we don't meet aliens in space and instead they come to earth - to conquer us? Dominic and leading writers and film-makers look at Science Fiction's obsession with alien invasion, from all-out assault to sinister hidden threats.

programme.title: The Vikings Uncovered
programme.desc: Dan Snow uncovers the lost Vikings in America with Space Archaeologist Dr Sarah Parcak. Sarah use satellites 383 miles above the earth to spot ruins as small as 30cms, buried beneath the surface. As Sarah searches for Viking sites from Britain to America, Dan explores how they voyaged thousands of miles when most ships never left the shoreline. He also tracks their expansion west as first raiders, then settlers and traders throughout Britain and beyond to Iceland and Greenland.

programme.title: Secret Knowledge
programme.desc: To mark 250 years since William Hogarth's death, ceramics expert and self-confessed Hogarth fanatic, Lars Tharp, is determined to solve a mystery that has consumed his personal and professional life - the case of Hogarth's lost pug.

programme.title: Mud, Sweat and Tractors: The Story of Agriculture
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the history of 20th century milk farming, from the early years of the century when 150,000 dairy farmers milked by hand and sold milk door to door, to the end of the century, with milk being sold through supermarkets.

programme.title: Clydebuilt: The Ships That Made the Commonwealth
programme.desc: David Hayman travels to Halifax in Canada to investigate the story of CS Mackay-Bennett and to unravel a DNA mystery that's taken over a century to solve.

programme.title: Port
programme.desc: Julie and Muireann visit North Uist in the Western Isles of Scotland. Accompanying them from Ireland are renowned piper and bodhran player Donnchadh Gough and the brilliant musician, Sile Denvir. The Uists have long been noted for their singing and piping heritage and prime exponents of both traditions are assembled here.

programme.title: Mnathan Gluine: Spairn gu slaint
programme.desc: Documentary revisiting four families facing some of the most challenging times of their lives as their babies battle serious health issues. Casey from Skye was born with a cleft lip and palate and underwent two major operations during his first year. Cole from Nairn was born three months premature and spent many weeks in hospital, but his mother Kirsty is delighted to have him back home. She now takes great pleasure in the everyday things, such as taking him out for a walk.

programme.desc: Pilot Julie Angel flies from Oban Airport to Colonsay and Islay. programme.title: Trusadh
programme.desc: Following Muriel Fisher and her continued interest in the Gaelic language and culture despite moving to another country. Muriel has been in Tucson, Arizona, for 30 years, but she has not forgotten her people or the language they gave her. Indeed, she has motivated the people of Tucsonto learn Gaelic and was awarded the Linguistics Society of America Prize for her community language work. Muriel returns to Skye every year to visit Glendale, the place where she was born and brought up.

programme.title: Bloomberg Technology
programme.desc: Technology is not only becoming an increasingly important part of people's lives but also of the American economy. "Bloomberg Technology' takes a look at how the latest happenings in the tech industry are affecting the US markets. Analysis, commentary, interviews and interactive graphics are among the staples of the show that help viewers understand the impact the technology sector has on the economy. The show, which was originally titled `Bloomberg West", is anchored by Emily Chang in San Francisco.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Australia
programme.desc: Bloomberg continues the expansion of its "Daybreak' franchise with this version that includes reporting from New York and Sydney, Australia. `Daybreak: Australia' delivers news from the Australian market as well as developments from around the world that matter to decision-makers in the finance industry. This instalment of `Daybreak" joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia
programme.desc: With Asia being about half a day ahead of America, when people are getting ready to settle in for the night in the US the day is just starting in places like China and Japan that are important to the global economy. Featuring anchors in both New York and Hong Kong, "Bloomberg Daybreak Asia' features business and financial guests, in addition to providing insights into news and movements in global markets. This instalment of `Daybreak" joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: Asia
programme.desc: In an effort to provide extensive coverage of worldwide financial markets, Bloomberg features several regional shows under the "Bloomberg Markets' banner, with each focusing on that geographic area"s markets. This Asian-focused version is hosted by Shery Ahn, David Ingles, Haidi Lun, Rishaad Salamat and Angie Lau. They report the latest business news and speak with the likes of political and business leaders to help investors make decisions that build their portfolios.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Middle East
programme.desc: A focus on global macro issues with a Middle Eastern context.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe
programme.desc: "Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe' joins the network's lineup to deliver viewers information about business and financial news from the region. Manus Cranny and Anna Edwards host the show from London, joined by business professionals and journalists who offer their thoughts on the day's industry happenings. This instalment of `Daybreak" joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: European Open
programme.desc: Thanks to the time difference between the locations, the financial markets in Europe open when most Americans are sleeping. Bloomberg covers the start of the European trading day with this show - which airs in the early morning hours in the Eastern time zone - as part of the network's programming block dedicated to covering financial activity overseas. The show, broadcast from London, features discussions of the stories that are expected to impact the European markets that day and, subsequently, other markets around the world.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance
programme.desc: Insight on the top business stories and the state of the markets.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas
programme.desc: "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas' joins the network's lineup to deliver viewers information about business and financial news from the region. Jonathan Ferro, Alix Steel and David Westin host the show from New York, joined by business professionals and journalists who offer their thoughts on the day's industry happenings. This instalment of `Daybreak" joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets
programme.desc: The most important global business and breaking markets news and information as it happens.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: Americas
programme.desc: In an effort to provide extensive coverage of worldwide financial markets, Bloomberg features several regional shows under the "Bloomberg Markets' banner, with each focusing on that geographic area"s markets. This American-focused version is hosted by Mark Barton, Scarlet Fu, David Gura and Vonnie Quinn. They report the latest business news and speak with the likes of political and business leaders to help investors make decisions that build their portfolios.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: European Close
programme.desc: Thanks to the time difference between the locations, the financial markets in Europe close when the American markets are still in full swing. Bloomberg covers the end of the European trading day with this half-hour show - which airs in the morning US time, afternoon in Europe - during the network's "Bloomberg Markets' programming block. The show is hosted by two anchors on separate continents - Betty Liu in Bloomberg's New York studio and Mark Barton in London - who discuss the stories that impacted the European markets that day. The show also features sound bites from some of the day"s biggest news.

programme.title: Bloomberg Technology
programme.desc: Technology is not only becoming an increasingly important part of people's lives but also of the American economy. "Bloomberg Technology' takes a look at how the latest happenings in the tech industry are affecting the US markets. Analysis, commentary, interviews and interactive graphics are among the staples of the show that help viewers understand the impact the technology sector has on the economy. The show, which was originally titled `Bloomberg West", is anchored by Emily Chang in San Francisco.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: Americas
programme.desc: In an effort to provide extensive coverage of worldwide financial markets, Bloomberg features several regional shows under the "Bloomberg Markets' banner, with each focusing on that geographic area"s markets. This American-focused version is hosted by Mark Barton, Scarlet Fu, David Gura and Vonnie Quinn. They report the latest business news and speak with the likes of political and business leaders to help investors make decisions that build their portfolios.

programme.title: What'd You Miss?
programme.desc: People are busy in the fast-paced world these days and may miss some of the news in the financial world that affects their investments. Bloomberg has that covered with this daily, half-hour show anchored by Alix Steel and Joe Weisenthal. After the market closes, they analyse what they took out of the day's activities around the world and what viewers can take away from it. While the show is sophisticated enough to reach a Wall Street audience, Steel and Weisenthal also aim to make their information clear enough that even casual investors can learn something.

programme.title: Bloomberg Technology
programme.desc: Technology is not only becoming an increasingly important part of people's lives but also of the American economy. "Bloomberg Technology' takes a look at how the latest happenings in the tech industry are affecting the US markets. Analysis, commentary, interviews and interactive graphics are among the staples of the show that help viewers understand the impact the technology sector has on the economy. The show, which was originally titled `Bloomberg West", is anchored by Emily Chang in San Francisco.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Australia
programme.desc: Bloomberg continues the expansion of its "Daybreak' franchise with this version that includes reporting from New York and Sydney, Australia. `Daybreak: Australia' delivers news from the Australian market as well as developments from around the world that matter to decision-makers in the finance industry. This instalment of `Daybreak" joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia
programme.desc: With Asia being about half a day ahead of America, when people are getting ready to settle in for the night in the US the day is just starting in places like China and Japan that are important to the global economy. Featuring anchors in both New York and Hong Kong, "Bloomberg Daybreak Asia' features business and financial guests, in addition to providing insights into news and movements in global markets. This instalment of `Daybreak" joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: The format of "Pointless Celebrities' is familiar to anyone familiar with the original version of `Pointless' with the big difference being celebrities playing for charities instead of regular contestants playing to win money for themselves. The famous pairs answer questions that were asked to 100 people in a survey. The celebrities" goal is to provide the correct answers that were given by the fewest surveyed individuals with a correct answer given by nobody else, dubbed a pointless answer, being most desirable as it earns the team no points - which is good in a game in which the goal is to score as few points as possible. The winning pair advances to the final round where they can win money for their favourite charities.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Four strangers work together as a team to answer general knowledge questions on this quiz show. Their opponent? The Chaser, a ruthless quiz genius tasked with stopping the contestants from winning money, potentially thousands of pounds. The contestants take turns answering quick-fire questions in a set length of time in order to build up the team's pot. Each contestant then goes one-on-one against The Chaser. The Chaser follows the contestant down a game board. If the contestant gets out without being caught, the money he or she earned is added to the team's pot. If a contestant is caught (by answering questions incorrectly), the contestant is out of the game and no money is added to the team's pot. The final round features the remaining contestants in another quick-fire round in which each correct answer gets them closer to the finish line. If The Chaser catches all the contestants, they leave with nothing. If any contestants remain at the end of the game, they split the team's money.

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: The classic game show, originally presented from 1988 to 2003 by William G. Stewart, is now presented by the experienced game show and trivia host Sandi Toksvig. Every episode, 15 contestants stand behind lecterns in a semi circle facing the quizmaster, where they are asked a series of very difficult questions with just three seconds to respond. Each contestant has three lives before they are eliminated. In total, twelve contestants are eliminated during the first two rounds, leaving the final three to compete in the final round. The winners of this round are then invited back at a later date to compete in the "Grand Final" against the other winners, with the chance of winning a 40,000 cash prize.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: While Martin prepares for his first night's work as a security guard, a busy Frasier, Niles and the gang fuss over who will get stuck with walking Eddie, prompting a peeved Martin to recall his tragic last night as a cop, and his partner's warning not to let his family become strangers to each other. Meanwhile, Daphne and Niles are in a dither when they each buy tickets to rival concerts on the same night.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz loves everything about her new man, except his profession, and Frasier throws a party for his radio staff to change his image.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon heads to country music's spiritual home, Nashville, Tennessee, but his visit begins on a sour note at Chappy's Cajun restaurant. Chef John "Chappy' Chapman"s careless methods have hurt his local reputation.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Mayor Karen Freeman-Wilson goes undercover in her city of Gary, Indiana. Gary was once known as the magic city and considered the "Steel Capital of the Midwest", but it has since suffered a huge economic and population loss.

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Includes sport and weather.

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Geunor and Ian have left Cheltenham in search of the perfect property in Cornwall. Ian hopes to revive his passion for surfing, while Geunor wants to immerse herself in community life.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: A divorcee from Newcastle wants to pawn her 185k necklace to pay for her childrens' private school fees. Meanwhile, a Swarovski crystal-covered drum kit used on a Kylie Minogue tour gets staff member Patrick excited.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers. Barry McGuigan is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Neil Turner and his fiancee Zoe Brown from Leeds love Ibiza so much they're even planning on getting married on the Spanish island. Now, as the perfect wedding gift to each other they've decided to buy a holiday home there.

programme.title: The 100K Drop
programme.desc: Davina McCall is joined by John and Sarah, grandfather and granddaughter from Rotherham, and Lindsey and Vicky, a couple from Bournemouth. Will they get to win some cash?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second hosts of the week are mother and son team Trish and Connor Richardson from the Red Lion Coaching Inn near Gainsborough.

programme.title: Buy It Now
programme.desc: Tony from Ireland has a fun children's product to get close to nature, Nadine from Switzerland has a fashion garment she hopes the shoppers will buy in to, and Noam from London has some nifty magnetic stationery.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa tries to make herself more popular by writing good things about herself on the school blog, but the plan backfires.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Adam is trying to warn Maxine about Glenn, but Glenn is getting in the way. Meanwhile, Yazz attempts to offer Alfie support, but the voice in Alfie's head encourages him to decline.

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Includes sport and weather.

programme.title: The Political Slot
programme.desc: Ed Davey MP puts forward the Liberal Democrats' view on tackling violent crime.

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George Clarke takes on the 600-year-old legend of the Ty Unnos, a piece of Welsh folklore that claims that if you can build a house with four walls, a roof, and have a fire burning in your hearth in less than a day, then that house is yours.

programme.title: Cruises from Hell: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Jaw-dropping real-life footage, from the funny to the dramatic, shows what can go wrong when we venture onto water, from vast cruise ships in terrible weather to trouble on small canoes.

programme.title: Mo Salah: A Football Fairy Tale
programme.desc: Liverpool footballer Mo Salah shot to world stardom in one stellar season, with his goals carrying the club to the Champions League final. This documentary charts the rise of Salah from humble origins in Egypt to being voted best player in England.

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: A woman's body is found in overgrown grassland. When detectives inform her partner of her death, his behaviour marks him out as the chief suspect.

programme.title: Flight HS13
programme.desc: Liv and Haje get closer, and Alex is attacked. Kevin is tortured by Majid but discloses nothing. Simon is smuggled into Iran and is about to be handed over to Majid, when someone intervenes.

programme.title: The Sex Business
programme.desc: A young leading female star of the porn world has encouraged her new boyfriend to join the industry, a legendary cam girl, and gay porn star and fetish specialist reveal how a world of fantasy masks the costs paid by these performers in their lives.

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: An investigation into a terror campaign against the police in Belfast led by a 31 year old woman. Also the taxi cam footage that shows a shocking attack on two elderly passengers.

programme.title: America's Toughest Prisons
programme.desc: Ex-convict Donovan must learn to live "on the outside" after 14 years. He is forced to face his family, find work and confront his past. With two thirds of ex-cons ending back in prison, will he slip back to a life of crime?

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Gaming featuring roulette, blackjack, and autowheel.

programme.title: World's Greatest Mountains
programme.desc: Mont Blanc wasn't scaled until the late 18th century. Now it is the heart of European mountain sports with millions of visitors. The 7.5 mile tunnel through its heart was a miracle of 1960s engineering, but also suffered a catastrophic accident.

programme.title: Get Your Tatts Out: Kavos Ink
programme.desc: Harry gets his first inking with a pair of lips, and two boozed up couples from Ireland get stuck into some needle action. Londoner Tony gets a "go hard, or go home" inking on his leg, while Jay gets a tattoo to win his ex back.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Californian real-estate agent Ann Maurice assists a couple who are having difficulty selling their home in Southampton's prestigious marina development, Ocean Village.

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: The Venetian Tiziano Vecellio, known as Titian, pioneered the use of oils with a radical approach to light, colour, and brush strokes.

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: This long-running documentary series follows the work of Wildlife Aid, an animal rescue and rehabilitation centre based in Surrey, England. The show is presented by Wildlife Aid co-founder Simon Cowell (not the famous music executive) and veterinary nurse Sara Cowen. While Cowell is generally featured lampooning around the countryside rescuing wildlife, Cowen is shown managing the centre's hospital, backed by a team of vets, wildlife experts and many volunteers.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family spot a rainbow when they go for a drive.

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: Suzie breaks down for the first time. When she gets to Mick's garage, Bazza convinces her that she doesn't just need repairing, but that she's getting old and needs a makeover - a Bazza Special!

programme.title: Luo Bao Bei
programme.desc: Faye copies everything LBB does, which is driving her mad. LBB resorts to drastic measures to avoid her friend, until she realises that imitation can be the sincerest form of flattery.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: In the park, Simon's older cousin Maxime and his friend Renaud tell Simon and Lou that they are too little to join in their game of football. Simon and Lou are determined to prove them wrong, and get their chance when the big boys try to show off on their skateboard - at least Simon manages to stay on his!

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.desc: No one can play hide-and-seek in Brickabuild until Noddy can find out who has painted the workshop wall blue!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: At the veterinary clinic, Hannah forgets her promise to her mum, and lets a fox out of its cage. Norman and Hannah try to catch the fox before Lizzie returns.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: When Bradford the Brake Van arrives from the mainland, Thomas is delighted to work with him as he is excellent at keeping the Troublesome Trucks under control. He is also a real stickler for the rules, which keeps making Thomas late, but when Thomas decides to go off without him, he gets into trouble.

programme.title: The Secret Life of Puppies
programme.desc: Tickle and her brothers and sisters see their reflections in the mirror for the first time, and are not sure what to make of it all. Ruby is let off her lead for the first time in the park.

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Zeta steals Shimmer, Shine, and Leah's wishing star, and they must get it back before Zeta makes a wish.

programme.title: Shane the Chef
programme.desc: Shane agrees to take part in a sponsored run to raise money for a donkey sanctuary. With Sid Singh in charge of his training, Shane finds himself on early morning runs and only allowed food that will give him energy.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle introduces a new pupil to the playgroup, Emily Elephant, and everyone wants to be her friend because she's very good at building blocks and can make a very loud noise with her trunk.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George visit Mr Fox's Shop to buy Granny and Grandpa an anniversary present, but what will they choose from the shop that sells everything?

programme.title: Ben & Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The visitors venture out of the rockets onto the moon, but they soon realise that they do not have enough fuel to get back to the Little Kingdom.

programme.title: PAW Patrol
programme.desc: Daring Danny's at it again. Luckily the Pups are able to raise their rig after Danny sinks the Paw Patroller.

programme.title: Floogals
programme.desc: When an ice cube lands on the kitchen floor on a hot summer day, the Floogals investigate, leading to an adventure that includes speed skating and scaling the giant refrigerator.

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: There's a water-shortage in Applecross. Digby and his friends go in search of the reason.

programme.title: Nella the Princess Knight
programme.desc: A dragon bully causes problems in the kingdom.

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: Mofy thinks that a little beetle is a gigantic monster because she is looking at it through glass. Through her mistake, Mofy learns that things are not always what they seem and that what looks small to us can be huge for someone else.

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright dissects and discusses the morning's news headlines and with panellists and a guest.

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take it Away!
programme.desc: The agents encounter a feisty dispute in a takeaway, rent evaders living in potentially lethal conditions, tenants scammed by a fake landlord, and a businessman on the brink of financial ruin.

programme.title: 5 News at Lunchtime
programme.desc: National and international news.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A young man seeks help because he is hearing voices, Dr Hardy meets a new patient who has a number of handwritten notes that he can't remember compiling, and Dr Pelly is delighted that a patient is responding well to treatment for schizophrenia.

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: A daily round-up of showbiz news and gossip from around the world.

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Justin turns up to deliver the ransom, but Raffy has alerted the police and the kidnapper speeds off. However, Willow recognises the kidnapper from his description. Roo tells the Astonis that Coco is falling behind at school.

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Steph steps in to take control at Xanthe's party. Her initial reaction is to cancel Gary's trial period as manager, but Sheila persuades her to give him a second chance. Xanthe considers a new direction in her life.

programme.title: Celebrity 5 Go Motorhoming
programme.desc: The celebrities visit waterfalls in the Brecon Beacons, paddle on unspoilt beaches on the Gower peninsula, and make a splash in the waters of the stunning Pembrokeshire coast, all while the cosy living conditions bring this company of celebrity strangers closer.

programme.title: Fatal Performance
programme.desc: When an aspiring young actress is hired to impersonate the wife of a businessman at a major reception, she soon finds out that she is being used a pawn in a murder plot.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: The First Dates restaurant serves up another platter of hopeful singletons. As Alex pretends to speak fluent Italian, he and Chelsea bond over a banana. Will Alex be honest with Chelsea or will she fall for his charm? Colin, who was born with a birth defect resulting in a missing leg, has been on over 100 first dates.

programme.title: Wonders of the Solar System
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox visits some of the most stunning locations on Earth to describe how the laws of nature have carved natural wonders across the solar system. Brian explores the powerhouse of them all, the sun. In India he witnesses a total solar eclipse, and in Norway he watches the battle between the sun's wind and Earth, as the night sky glows with the Northern Lights.

programme.title: Dino Hunt Canada
programme.desc: In the Bay of Fundy, scientists search for the earliest dinosaurs; a team in British Columbia tracks dino-prints up a steep rock face.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: The fragile ecosystems that have grown around the worlds coral reefs. The reefs take hundreds of years to develop and are adorned with spectacularly colourful life. However, this is not always an idyllic tropical paradise: one big storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Set in Wyoming's spectacular Rocky Mountains, the dramatic story of two mountain lion mothers struggling to raise their kittens is helping scientists rewrite our understanding of these elusive predators.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A look at mountains, beginning with the birth of a mountain at one of the lowest places on Earth, and ending at the summit of Everest. Experience the full force of an avalanche in the Rockies, where grizzlies survive the harsh winters deep inside the dangerous slopes, and fly alongside demoiselle cranes as they attempt to cross the Himalayas.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: This programme looks at the wildlife that congregates around Africa's lakes and rivers, including the flamingos of east Africa's soda lakes, giant crocodiles battling with buffalo on the banks of the Luangwa River in Zambia, and the massive clouds of flies that erupt across the waters of the Rift Valley lakes.

programme.desc: How do the tides affect marine life? Find out with the giant stingrays that glide on currents, the snails that surf the waves in pursuit of a meal, and the dolphins that play a deadly game of catch.

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the intimate story of a leopard mother and her two cubs. This very special family must survive in the wilds of Botswana alongside some less than friendly neighbours, lions, wild dogs and hyenas.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A look at deserts, which cover a third of the earth's land surface. From space they appear lifeless but a closer inspection reveals a different picture. Deserts are in fact surprisingly varied, from Mongolia's Gobi desert, where wild Bactrian camels have to eat snow in lieu of water, to the Atacama in Chile where guanacos survive by licking the dew off cactus spines.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: A natural history series exploring the Galapagos Islands, which lie 1,000 kilometres off the coast of South America. The opening episode examines the fascinating stages of the islands' lives and how a variety of creatures have found ways to survive, including marine iguanas, sea-going lizards and giant tortoises.

programme.title: Wonders of the Solar System
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox reveals how all the beauty and order we see in our cosmic backyard was carved out of nothing more than a chaotic cloud of gas. Chasing tornados in Oklahoma, Brian explains how the same physics that creates these spinning storms shaped the young solar system, and out of this celestial maelstrom emerged Brian's second wonder - the magnificent rings of Saturn.

programme.desc: With vengeance coursing through Jack's veins, his friends do all they can to pacify him: Harry and Cam focus him on a prospective equine venture; Barry Tregear threatens him with the full force of the law; and even Linda returns from the Philippines to care for him.

programme.title: Legion
programme.desc: David and Divison 3 grow concerned after a strange and uneasy reunion leads to a shocking truth.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian and Stewie travel back in time to the pilot episode of "Family Guy" to change history, and then to change history again.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois cooks a big Thanksgiving meal and invites the whole crew over for dinner. Joe is shocked when his formerly MIA son, Kevin Swanson, returns from Iraq.

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Steve is selling chocolate for his school's charity drive, but after Roger eats the whole box without paying, Steve accuses him of being selfish.

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: After local news anchorman Greg and his longtime boyfriend and co-anchor Terry split up, Francine tries to help Greg find a new partner.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Death asks Peter to fill in for him while he recovers from a sprained ankle at the Griffins' house.

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: As the Smiths continue to live in Saudi Arabia, Stan is fully enjoying the male-dominated society, while the rest of the family struggles with the different social norms. Meanwhile, Francine's musical expose on gender roles gets her into trouble, and a brush with death leads the Smiths to return to the United States.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Quagmire lands himself in the hospital and his sister, Brenda, and her boyfriend, Jeff, rush to Quahog to nurse him back to health. As Glenn recovers, he quickly realises that Brenda is the one who needs help.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Ryan Reynolds pays a visit to Quahog and becomes obsessed with Peter. Meanwhile, Stewie tries to be a big boy and steals the family car for a joy ride but lands in a bit of trouble.

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: When Stan buys Francine Washington Nationals' season tickets for her birthday she is upset. The situation goes from bad to worse when the couple cannot even manage a proper kiss for the stadium's 'Kiss Cam,' and Stan sets out to make things right between them.

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan is excited when he is put in charge of the CIA's number one fundraiser, the annual calendar. He hires Haley to be his assistant, but she has ulterior motives for taking the job.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Bringing the best in entertainment and teleshopping.

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Monk investigates when the world's oldest man is murdered just one day short of his 115th birthday.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Someone takes their repulsion for reality television too far. Brennan and Booth are called into action when the host of a trashy TV show is killed.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth investigate when a man is mauled to death by man's best friend. Will they catch the culprit responsible?

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon takes another look at the murky world of billionaire businessman Tommy Volker, as well as helping Jane to catch the killer of an up-and-coming model.

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The team search for a young witness who can bring down Lisbon's long-time prey, businessman Tommy Volker.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: It's Christmas time and Tony DiNozzo can't decide if he'll be naughty or nice when his dad, Anthony DiNozzo Sr, comes to town for a visit.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While the NCIS team investigates the link between a dead journalist and a Navy petty officer, Ziva is taken aback by a sudden visit from her father, who she hasn't seen in more than two years.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Clutching at straws, Booth and Brennan are forced to turn to Zack Addy, their former friend and serial killer sidekick, for help.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth are called into action when an unpopular office manager is murdered. Can they catch the culprit responsible?

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane comes close to establishing a solid link between Bret Stiles' Visualize cult and Red John, as he and Lisbon investigate three murders from the eighties.

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and Jane enter the murderously competitive world of academia when a research student pays the ultimate price for discovering a new species of moth.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: In the aftermath of an event that strikes close to home, the NCIS team unites to seek answers and demand justice in order to protect their most vulnerable colleagues.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates a Marine's car accident and ignites some upsetting past memories for Abby as a young girl on the trail of her first case.

programme.title: Legion
programme.desc: What could have been is the question on everyone's lips when Madness visits Division Three.

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: When Stan buys Francine Washington Nationals' season tickets for her birthday she is upset. The situation goes from bad to worse when the couple cannot even manage a proper kiss for the stadium's 'Kiss Cam,' and Stan sets out to make things right between them.

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan is excited when he is put in charge of the CIA's number one fundraiser, the annual calendar. He hires Haley to be his assistant, but she has ulterior motives for taking the job.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: On the return from an adventurous day at an amusement park, the Griffin's car breaks down in Amish country and they are stranded with no way out. When Meg falls for an Amish boy, the Griffins then find themselves in a crusade against the conservative locals.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and the guys take a stand against their wives and flee to the Deep South on a road trip. On their Deep South road trip, Peter and the guys earn a one-way ticket to jail, then decide to make a run for it.

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: In the wake of The Blast, an apocalyptic event that has reduced the world to a no-man's land, a tattoo-covered Stan returns to Langley Falls in search of his family, unsure if they are even alive. As Stan searches the desolate wasteland he tells his travelling companions the stories behind his tattoos, each of which relates to a haunting familial memory that fills him with regret.

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: After Steve and Snot are humiliated at a "cool kids" party, they decide to throw a party of their own and only invite other unpopular kids. Meanwhile, when Roger and Haley dine out, he takes it personally when the waitress compliments her order but not his.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glamorous go-getter Charlotte Langley, who's laying on a "Night with the Stars'. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Swipe Right For Murder
programme.desc: When 62-year-old Lorraine Long from Arizona ended a relationship with a man she had met on an online dating website, he shot her dead in a fit of jealous rage.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: In the mid-1970s, the north of England was terrorised by a vicious criminal known as the Black Panther. Among hundreds of burglaries and armed robberies, several sub-postmasters were shot dead. Then in January 1975, he abducted, ransomed and killed schoolgirl Lesley Whittle. When the Black Panther was eventually unmasked, his identity was revealed as Donald Neilson, a self-employed jobbing builder and family man who was obsessed with reliving his army life.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Bringing the best in entertainment and teleshopping.

programme.title: Swipe Right For Murder

programme.title: Kings Cross ER
programme.desc: The team at St Vincent's treat a man under the influence of narcotics who collapsed in a shopping centre. See if they will be able to get to the bottom of what he took.

programme.title: Kings Cross ER
programme.desc: Resources are pushed to the limit when a night of revelry on a Sydney Harbour boat goes horribly wrong and a mystery pill has partygoers dropping like flies. The team must calm the situation at hand.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: Homeless Romanians have taken over a key underpass. Oxford Street police are given new powers to move them on, but will they go quietly? Christmas comes early as a specialist team sets about getting the street's lights up, but all doesn't go to plan.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Bringing the best in entertainment and teleshopping.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise is on the trail of a stunning rural property in Cumbria, a county renowned for its incredible scenery. Today's buyers have a budget of 900,000 and are looking for a super-sized substantial family home. Denise also checks out hound trailing.

programme.title: My Dream Home
programme.desc: Looking to downsize and move out of the suburbs and into the city, Tina and James have huge expectations and a tiny budget. Drew and Jonathan Scott help the couple.

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick and his skilful builders are in Bradford to renovate a lounge for Emma and her nine-year-old son Thomas. Contemporary, warm and full of mod-cons is the brief for designer Julia Kendell. Emma spent five years saving up for her own house and ended up buying a wreck of a place knowing that her dad would help her out with the DIY. Unfortunately, injuries from a motorbike accident flared up meaning dad couldn't help out as much.

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team is in Frimley to help the Oxford family - Lisa, Andy and son Jordan. The Oxfords had just started a double-storey extension on their property when Lisa was diagnosed with brain cancer. Husband Andy took time off work to nurse her and look after Jordan, leaving no time or money to finish the extension. Nick, designer Julia and the team turn up to complete the work and create a fabulous bedroom for Lisa and Andy.

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: A specialist police team hunt for a snatched bag that contains over 100,000 of cash. Rush hour leaves blood on the tracks at Oxford Circus.

programme.desc: A man barely able to make ends meet is baffled when a superstar comes to his village. The villagers discover that he knows the star, and urge him to introduce them.

programme.desc: The job experiences of two glamour-smitten friends reflect the similarity between two sides of the same coin.

programme.title: Money Hai Toh Honey Hai
programme.desc: The eventful and whirlwind journey of Bobby along with five losers, Lala Bhai, Gaurav, Manik, Shruti and Ashima. After getting an SMS from a cranky old man who offers them positions at a nearby resort separately, they all decide to give it a try. They reach the resort and begin enjoying their new positions. Will the six be able to successfully run the resort, or will they fight amongst themselves?

programme.title: Maine Pyaar Kyun Kiya
programme.desc: A flirtatious orthopedic surgeon Samir befriends beautiful girls and then dumps them saying that he is married. Chaos starts when the girl who Samir falls in love with insists on meeting his wife.

programme.desc: Watch Anupama Chopra as she reviews the latest in Bollywood and Hollywood.

programme.desc: Karan Johar hosts celebrities as they reveal gossip and their secrets.

programme.title: Anamika
programme.desc: A woman-hating writer rescues a young woman lying injured on the road. When she regains consciousness, she insists that she is his wife.

programme.title: Maa Beti
programme.desc: Savitri lives with her husband and daughter, Meenu. She gives birth to a son, Khetan, and tragically passes away. Her husband re-marries a woman named Laxmi.

programme.desc: In 1895, Shivkar Bapuji Talpade constructs and flies India's first unmanned plane, despite having the odds stacked against him.

programme.desc: A solitary man wages a tireless battle to save ordinary people from the ever-present threats of corruption and injustice.

programme.desc: Three people in dire need of money become involved in a gangster's plot to kidnap a wealthy man's grandson.

programme.desc: As the president debates where to spend Thanksgiving, American Indians camp out in the White House in search of improved public health projects for their reservation.

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: While the president copes with a possible mad cow disease epidemic, Josh delicately handles a U.N. treaty to ban prostitution, and World War II veterans stage a protest.

programme.title: The West Wing

programme.title: House

programme.title: House

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation

programme.desc: The T-virus unleashed by the evil Umbrella Corporation has spread to every corner of the globe, infesting the planet with zombies, demons and monsters. Alice, a former Umbrella employee turned rogue warrior, joins her friends on a last-chance mission to storm the company's headquarters located deep underneath what used to be Raccoon City. But the Red Queen knows that Alice is coming, and the final battle will determine if the rest of mankind lives or dies.

programme.title: Coming to America
programme.desc: An extremely pampered African prince travels to Queens, New York, and goes undercover to find a wife whom he can respect for her intelligence and will.

programme.title: Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
programme.desc: The stages of life are told through multiple sketches and songs by the British comedy troupe. The seven parts of life cover birth, growing up, war, middle age, organ transplants, old age and death. Not all stages are singular - "Part I: The Miracle of Birth" is from the perspective of an ignored woman in labour, and of a Roman Catholic couple with too many children. "Part VII: Death" encompasses a funeral and heaven. Added are three unrelated skits placed in the beginning, middle and end.

programme.title: Raising Arizona
programme.desc: Fast-paced farce about an unlikely pair who go to extreme lengths to have a child. When an incompetent robber marries a policewoman, they discover that they are infertile. In order to appease his wife's longings for a child, the man steals one of a set of quintuplets, but mayhem ensues when the child's rich father sends a rabbit-shooting bounty hunter after the kidnapper.

programme.title: Turner & Hooch
programme.desc: Detective Scott Turner is an uptight, by-the-book police officer who hopes to leave his sleepy California town and work in the big city. When his friend Amos Reed, the proprietor of a junkyard, is killed, Turner reluctantly inherits the man's dog. Realising that the canine may be able to help him solve the murder case, Turner attempts to adjust to life with the big dog, resulting in much household destruction and unwelcome chaos.

programme.title: The Top Ten Show 2018
programme.desc: Which movies are doing the best business at home and across the pond? Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.

programme.title: Don't Think Twice
programme.desc: Turmoil strikes a New York improv troupe when one member leaves to star in a television show and the others realise they might not make it big after all.

programme.title: The Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear
programme.desc: Lt Frank Drebin returns for more madcap high jinks in this police-procedural spoof. Powerful energy corporations are intent on putting a halt to the eco-friendly plans of Dr Albert S. Meinheimer, the new US energy czar. They scheme to replace Meinheimer with an imposter who will do their bidding. Unfortunately for them, Drebin gets tangled up with their plans while trying to steal back his ex from her slimy new beau.

programme.title: Shallow Hal
programme.desc: When a shallow man who only dates young and beautiful women is hypnotised by a motivational entrepreneur, he quickly becomes smitten with an inwardly perfect young woman who weighs 300lbs. However, their love is put to the test by his innate superficiality when his friend undoes the hypnosis.

programme.title: The Other Guys
programme.desc: While New York detectives Christopher Danson and PK Highsmith wow the city with their heroics, colleagues Allen Gamble and Terry Hoitz are the "other guys'. Chained to their desks, forensic accountant Gamble and disgraced cop Hoitz are at each other"s throats when an unfortunate incident gives them the opportunity to prove themselves.

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two hard-partying brothers bring two wild and uncontrollable women to their sister's wedding in Hawaii.

programme.title: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Though broke and lovelorn, a woman takes on the strange and expensive rituals associated with being her best friend's maid of honour.

programme.title: Hitch
programme.desc: Albert is neither the most attractive nor the most confident man in the world, so when he falls in love with one of his firm's clients, Allegra Cole, he calls in an expert to help him win her over. Hitch is the business name of Alex Hitchins, and he earns his pay by teaching men how to woo the girl of their choice.
